Description: Typical range for Nd:YAG lasers in metal cleaning; lower end for sensitive substrates like Cerium to avoid melting (melting point ~795°C). Recommended starting at 50 W for contamination removal. Max safe before damage based on thermal conductivity (~11 W/m·K). Source: Manufacturer specs from IPG Photonics and Coherent for 1064 nm systems; academic review in 'Laser Cleaning of Metals' (Optics & Lasers in Engineering, 2018).
Near-IR wavelength for optimal Cerium absorption and thermal processing
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning control on Cerium surfaces
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled ablation of Cerium oxides
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Recommended number of passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal pulse overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive heating
